data.title: Worst hotel ever
data.text: This place is a dump. I hit my foot on a piece of metal sticking out from under the bed. Had to switch rooms twice. Place is dirty!!! Never stay here. Had to request sheets & covers for pull out couch after they knew we were using it.

data.title: Give a credit to Brett
data.text: We read the reviews before checked in this hotel.  Lower our expectation to minimum.  The TV, telephone and microwave were for decoration only, they were not functioning.  No hot water in the shower.  The pressure of water flow was low.  On the positive side, the bed was comfort, a/c and wifi worked well.  Hair dryer, iron and refrigerstor worked fine. Had to give a credit to the front desk staff, Brett; he was super friendly and tried to help as much as he could.

data.title: Do not waste your time.
data.text:
I should have known from the minute I pulled up that this was not going to be good. The front door was locked and you had to pull into the valet area which was dirty and had plywood over some of the windows that was knocked out of the entrance way. Had to immediately climb a set of steps to reach the lobby. The lobby was dark and you could see lots of hand made signs all over that suggested "low budget". I was checked into my room on the 9th floor and I cautiously walked to the elevator. Elevator was OK and i arrived on the 9th floor. Immediately I was greeted with hot air; there was no AC in the hall. My room was very dated. The TV was probably from the late 90's and when i turned it on all i got was static; no picture. I checked the bedding and it seemed safe and clean. The bathroom was OK and seemed clean but not very well stocked. 
As i looked around the room the smoke detector was gone and bare wires extended from the wall. The safety latch on the door was loose and not well secured. The door had a hole at the bottom that allowed light to pass under; it was a half round hole that looked like a mouse might have chewed its way thru? I started to think that being on the 9th floor without a smoke detector in the room did not seem safe.
I called the front desk to ask to move; no one answered. I waited and called back two more times. Still no answer so i decided it was time to leave.
I grabbed my gear and spoke with nice lady at the desk and said there were several problems with the room and I did not feel safe. She said she would cancel the reservation; she apologized and said they had no amenities available including TV? Less than 30 minutes later when I called the booking agent they could not reach the hotel; no one answered. i may never get that refund but I am glad I left.

data.title: Poor management... Terrible Customer service
data.text: I am absolutely disgusted with Dayton Grand Hotel. The manager Nichole Perez was not even available and had a new hire named Bonnie running the hotel for the weekend. My boyfriend and I booked the hotel for the weekend days in advanced. We arrived and check in. The front desk agent Bonnie, gave us directions to the elevator. We walk to the elevator and wait for about 10 mins for them to come. We ask what's the problem with the elevators and she tells us they've been having issues but they do work. We finally get to our room and the keys she gave us do not work. My boyfriend goes back downstairs to Bonnie to get the correct keys. He comes back, and we open the door only to find someone occupying the room. At this point we've had enough. We grab our belongs and go and speak to Bonnie. She informs us she's new and obviously does not know correct protocol in helping a displeased customer. She tells us the hotel is booked and she can not give us another room. I ask to speak to the manager, she tells me Nichole Perez is not there on the weekend. I am not from Dayton and I drove all the way here for a fun weekend with friends. I will never stay at Dayton Grand hotel ever again. They have subpar customer service, and have wasted my money and time. Thank you Nichole and Bonnie for a terrible weekend.

data.title: Would have rather slept in my car if I had to
data.text: I booked through a discount travel site.  Pictures say it all.  The front doors were locked and had a sign on them directing you to enter from the doors in the parking garage.  The parking garage entrance looked like it was getting renovated a while ago, but then abandoned.  Same with the front desk area.  It was dark and dingy ..... One person came from the back to greet me - no one else was in sight.  She told me a story about the hotel having new owners and the original company hired to renovate the hotel was fired because a chandelier fell from the ceiling. A sign at the front desk stated that the fitness center, sauna, pool and restaurant were closed for renovations.  It also said that there was no cable.  I can't believe they are even open.  I didn't even go to a room before requesting a full refund from the booking agency.  To their credit, the "all sales are final" policy was not enforced in this case.  Despite what some sites say, this is not a 3.5 star hotel - It's a 0 - it shouldn't be open.

data.title: Do not go there
data.text: The hotel is disgusting and terrible. It should be shut down for multiple health code violations. We walked in and walked out 5 minutes later. The receptionist seemed to be used to people doing that and cancelled our reservation at no charge.

data.title: Your belongings will be searched and stolen...if you stay here don't leave anything in the room while you are away
data.text:
I was shocked   , a few items from my suitcase (sweatshirt , cap ,polo shirt..). have been stolen by hotel personnel .Luckily did not have any valuable items !
Hotel is in very  bad shape poor cleanliness and maintenance ,no TV program available, no wireless internet available,no breakfast,ice machine broken - no ice available...it is not smoking free environment- whole floor full of cigarette smoke ...

data.title: Scary
data.text: I travel across the country and this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.  The fumes in the room were unbearable.  We had to switch rooms twice to find a room we could breathe in. My wife is pregnant and I had two young kids and simply did not feel safe. The rooms were extremely dirty, the cable didn't work, and the ac and heater did not work as well.  I cannot discourage this place enough.

data.title: Don't think about it!
data.text:
NO - No - No! don't think of staying here. it is not a place for one to feel relaxed and safe and comfortable. The room was TERRIBLE. There is no service except the poor young lady at the desk who has to put up with all the complaints. didn't take a shower , our tub was ugly looking and not clean. they say they r "under construction". Well maybe they would like to be but there is no sign of any work going on anywhere.  The safety lock on our door needed repaired and there was a nail sticking out of the bottom where someone had tried to repair it.
The only reason we did not go somewhere else was because of the no-reutrn policy.. Oh yes- and I forgot- NO TV- the cable is out. Really??

data.title: Under renovation when we went but otherwise, lovely property
data.text: The room itself was quite nice and spacious. It was a very comfortable stay with the exception that finding our way through the lobby and to the makeshift check-in desk was an experience, because most of the stairs are covered with plastic bags. It's very centrally located in Dayton which is helpful if you want to go to the nearby restaurants and bars.

data.title: Scary
data.text: My first room on the 9th floor was missing the smoke alarm which made my mind wander to what if a fire happened. It also made me wonder if the sprinkler system is operational (this hotel is in that bad a shape). Old tube TV's, peeling wallpaper and paint. It was cheap, I guess you get what you pay for but the pics are not indicative of what this hotel is.

data.title: Terrible!
data.text: Booked this after hotel designated for a conference around the corner was booked.  Never ever will I stay here again.  I went through 3 rooms. . First, room #1(on the 9th floor) had broken light, remote, and phone. The elevator no longer worked so I had to lug my bags down all the stairs and find my way to the front desk.  They moved me to room #2, which was full of cigarette smell.  Room #3 had food on the floor, a full trashcan of takeout food, tv and lights were on, dirty folded towels, and used coffee packets. None of the phones worked either. Packed up again and had to find my way down the stairwell.  I'm now back in room #1 only because I'm tired, stressed and it's too late to change my booking to another hotel. Went to get ice. .. empty machine with a trash bag full of beer bottles and condoms next to it. ..So much for a relaxing business trip away from home.

data.title: Waste of money
data.text: The hotel is in ill form and under the gise of being under renovation. There was no sign any work is actually being done. The whole hotel looked like it used to be abandoned and they slapped up some wallpaper to cover it up. The only thing nice was the shower and checking out!

data.title: Do not do it
data.text:
We were initially put on the 8th floor. One hallway on that floor had flickering lights. It was like "The Shining". You had to knock on the door in the lobby to get someone to come out. The desk clerk had a black eye. I'm sorry for her, but it creates a kind of sketchy image in light of the whole ambiance. The hotel is not in good condition. Trim is falling off. Carpet is dirty and littered with debris in areas. The first room we were put in had a broken access system. I decided to make sure the door locked behind us, and it did not. Had no way to lock the door to leave the room. I wonder how many people did not notice. We changed rooms. 
     The elevator didn't work well. We pressed the button for the 7th floor and it took us to 4, then just stopped, no door opening or anything. Pressed 7 again and went to the 7th floor. This happened two times. The 2nd time it took us to the 5thfloor. Same thing. It seems dangerous.
     The parking garage looks like it's in Beruit. It could very well be in a war zone if you didn't know better. 
  Why is there a giant humidifier in the lobby with a giant tube that runs into the ceiling? 
   I have felt itchy since I stayed there one night. Hopefully that is my imagination, but I don't think so. 
    The night we stayed a clock was stolen out of the lobby. I didn't feel safe there before I heard that.

data.title: Room nice, hotel in renovation
data.text: We had a lovely suite with 2 large rooms, a comfortable bed, granite counter top in bathroom.  The TV was old, but worked well.  The wireless internet was actually very good.  The parking was not so great, the garage is somewhat run down with very sharp turns and litter.  The hotel itself is undergoing renovation so the pool and fitness room are closed.  Several areas of the hotel are closed, including the front desk, which is currently a table with a computer on it.  The staff we kind and the room was exceptionally clean.  The location is wonderful!  We walked to a very quaint area to eat, with lots of small shops, fantastic restaurants, microbrewery, and bars.  It's also within a block of the Arts center and theater district.  All within easy walking distance and felt very safe.

data.title: I'd Give It An "F."
data.text:
I reviewed this hotel two years ago and I gave it a C because it was "under renovation," then, too.  That renovation stuff is a bunch of hooey.  It's a run-down old hotel that manages to still get visitors because it masquerades as being under renovation.  

The restaurant, bar & pool weren't open two years ago.  Now, they've added the workout room, ice machines and the front desk to the things that are being "renovated."  The hotel sign just says, "HOTEL."  It doesn't even have a name anymore.  No more valet parking, so you have to park in a horrible, filthy garage that manages to stay dark ALL THE TIME.  I don't even know how they do that.  You'd think the sun would shine in there at some point during the day, but apparently not.  It was scary, as was the walk to my room.  

I think when the gal at the front card tables left at night, there were no longer staff on-site.  The bathroom reeked of mildew, which I think was coming from the shower curtain.  That would seem to be an easy fix, but apparently too difficult because of all the "renovations" going on.  I was there for four days and didn't see any work going on.  This hotel is a disaster and sites like Travelocity ought to be ashamed of their lack of quality control in listing this with a 73% positive rating.

Oh, and I put trash in the trash can near the elevator on the 3rd floor on September 11th.  It was still there when I left on the 14th.  Bet it's still there.

data.title: Hotel OK, but parking facility very poor.
data.text: Hotel under renovation, check in at makeshift lobby area, but not that bad.  We had a suite on 7 th floor, quite spacious.  Very very reasonable.   However, parking facility was bad.  Very narrow and dark, and stairway was filthy. Location good for a visit at University of Dayton.

data.title: WORST HOTEL EVER
data.text:
Hotel under construction - front desk a folding talbe and an I don't care attitude by staff.  I can't beleive Expedia let us book this.  Worst Hotel Ever but averter running 76 miles we had no choice to stay but trust we we would of ran away if we could of.  Markt to Market should be ashamed to list them as the hotel of choice for the Relay.
No gym, no restaurant, no lobby, no front door, no service, NO GO !!!

data.title: Worst Hotel Stay of My Life
data.text:
Staying at the Dayton Grand this past weekend was anything but grand. I stayed at the hotel a few years ago, when it was the Doubletree for a wedding and had a wonderful experience. The hotel then was beautiful and made quite an impression on my sister and I. My sister booked her wedding at the Kuhns building, about a block away, so staying at the Dayton Grand seemed like a great decision. When she called in January to block book rooms, she was told that they would be a fully renovated hotel by the weekend of her wedding, September 5 and that because she was booking at that time, she would still get the original prices of the rooms before they switched. It seemed too good to be true, and it was.

The hotel restaurant, gym, and pool were all closed. In addition, the parking garage had an entire section of ceiling missing right as you pulled in, the front doors had caution tape hanging on them, and the entire lobby was covered in debris, plastic coverings and tape. It looked like no work had gone on in this hotel for quite some time. The poor receptionist was set up in the decrepit lobby on the second floor with card tables and fans pointed towards her as there is no air conditioning in common areas. 

The second day there, two police cars sat out front as they took out an individual who had been staying illegally on one of the floors. Our rooms were not cleaned sufficiently and I had to ask for all of them to be cleaned again and all rooms booked in our block to be double checked before their arrival.

Not once did my sister receive notice that the hotel was still under renovation. In fact, no where on their website do they indicate that they are under construction at all. And to kick us when we were down, the manager denied telling her that renovations would be complete when she made her initial call. No one thought to let her know what to expect. She only found out the day before her wedding when she checked in...thinking she had booked a beautiful place for guests to stay. 

It felt like staying in a nightmare.  Looking back, I guess we should have checked more current reviews, but having stayed there before and having had a great experience, it never occurred to us. After looking at reviews from this time last year talking about renovations, I can't imagine that much work has been done, maybe it will never be.  All I can say is that this hotel was in absolute unacceptable shape for any person of any kind to be staying in. They should have closed to complete their work and reopened. I would not stay here until you've confirmed their work is done.

data.title: Worst hotel in the world
data.text: This is the worst hotel I have been to in the world and I have traveled to over 20 countries. I have lived in tents, huts and desert accommodations and the service and attitude of this place was worst that I have ever experienced. Stay as far away as possible from this hotel. They unilaterally told us we had been moved to a sub standard Ramada hotel 2 days before we were supposed to arrive for a conference. When we arrived at the Ramada they had no record of our reservation, which was supposed to have been made by the Grand. There were no Dayton grand staff that were available to help with this issue and we were stranded without a room at night after a 7 hour drive. They have promised a refund but keep delaying it.
